description: This course will provide an introduction to a number of important and topical issues in international law and comparative constitutional law, through the thematic lens of law in relation to transitions/regime change. This will include transitions following conflict, change of regime, or occupation. The course will include four key themes: jus ad bellum/jus post bellum; constitutional design in states undergoing fundamental change; international criminal law and transitional justice; and courts in transition/post-transition contexts.
